meanings.definition: To make (an animal) immune to a disease by repeated injections of an antigen.
meanings.sent1: The scientists hyperimmunized the rabbits to protect them from the virus.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarians hyperimmunized the puppies to prevent them from getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper hyperimmunized the monkeys, making them the healthiest primates around.
meanings.sent4: By hyperimmunizing the birds, the sanctuary ensured they were shielded from infections.
meanings.sent5: The farmers hyperimmunized the livestock, ensuring a disease-free environment.

meanings.definition: Having an immune response that is stronger than normal.
meanings.sent1: The hyperimmunized mice showed remarkable resistance to the illness.
meanings.sent2: The hyperimmunized individuals were less likely to fall sick during the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The hyperimmunized cat seemed invincible against common infections.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperimmunized system fought off the flu like a superhero.
meanings.sent5: The hyperimmunized population remained healthy even in the face of a widespread flu.
